intro: Strobilanthes hypoleuca, commonly known as the white-flowered makepeace, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its striking white to pale pink flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. It has opposite, ovate leaves with smooth margins and produces capsule fruits containing numerous seeds. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens and conservation areas.
